Solution: Update to Apache Tomcat version 7.0.52 or later.
Plugin Output: The remote Apache Tomcat service may be affected by a denial of service vulnerability.

Solution: If using WebSphere Application Server, apply Fix Pack 11 (7.0.0.11) or later.
Plugin Output: The remote application server is affected by multiple vulnerabilities.

Solution: If FrontPage is being used to administer the website, tighten the permissions. If not, remove the _vti_* directories and _vti_inf.html.
Plugin Output: The remote web server is configured insecurely.
The remote web server is affected by an information disclosure vulnerability.
The web server module on the remote host has a SQL injection vulnerability.

Solution: Upgrade to NaviCOPA 3.01 from 6th February 2009 or later as that reportedly resolves the issues.
Plugin Output: The remote web server is affected by multiple vulnerabilities.
The remote server is affected by a signature validation bypass vulnerability.

Solution: Fix the application so that the session cookie is re-generated after a successful authentication. Fix the cookie manipulation flaws.
Plugin Output: The remote web application is vulnerable to a session fixation attack.
